In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for your requirement:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```

This function `clean_column` takes a string `col` as input, converts it to lower case using the `lowercase` function and removes leading or trailing white spaces with `strip`. Then, it replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores using the `replace` function. The regular expression `r"[\s-]" => "_"` matches any whitespace character (`\s`) or a hyphen `-` and replaces them with an underscore `_`.
